comment.author: 13267298@N00
37865451@N00
comment._content: August 4, 1911 per NY Times "Last night he wore a light gray overcoat, a black suit, black derby and patent leather shoe" -Togo "Those in the party that went on board the Lusitania to welcome Admiral Togo were Third Assistant Secretary of State Chandler Hale and Capt. Templin M. Potts, U.S.N, representing the United States Government; Major Gen. Frederick D. Grant, commanding the Easter Division of the Army on Governors Island; Commander Hiraga, the Japanese Naval Attache in Washington; Mr. Hanihara, the First Secretary of the Japanese Embassy; Adjutant Gen. William Verbeck of the New York National Guard, who represented the State of New York, and Gen. Nelson H. Henry, the Surveyor of the Port." query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9C05EEDE1531E2...

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Ck tags for other photos from Togo's visit to the U.S.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo of the after-dark reception of Admiral Togo in New York. (Togo actually disembarked in New York after midnight, on the morning of August 4, 1911; the photographer may have been dozing -- his camera suffered a jolt during the exposure:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2162894853/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC -- your misspelling of Verbeck in the title has not been emended. The error appears to have originated with Bain.
